Observation Log 03

OBSERVATION METADATA
Log ID: DSL-03-2003-06-15
Location: Jellyfish Room, Tank J-01
Depth: Surface-level exhibit
Observer: M. Tanaka
Timestamp: 2003/06/15 18:45 JST
Classification: ROUTINE

Observation Notes

Evening documentation of moon jellyfish (Aurelia aurita) colony during "Moonlight Pulses" illumination cycle. Specimens display healthy translucency and active pulsation. Tentacle structure intact across all observed individuals.

Visitor engagement during this period remains high. Several school groups expressed interest in bioluminescence mechanics. Educational signage updated accordingly.

No anomalies detected. Standard feeding schedule maintained.

Technical Details

  • Image Quality: 95%
  • Camera: Exhibit Documentation Unit EDU-J1
  • Light Source: Blue LED cycle (wavelength 470nm)
  • Exposure Time: 0.5 seconds
  • Post-Processing: Contrast enhancement for public display

Visitor Notes

Popular photo opportunity. Consider implementing visitor photography guidelines to reduce flash exposure impacting specimens.

Educational Value
This observation demonstrates typical jellyfish behavior in controlled aquarium environments. Moon jellyfish serve as excellent educational specimens due to their resilience and visual appeal. No special authorization required for viewing.
